item_object.item_desc: Rappers will tell you that 40's are good for you. And you know what? They are good for you, because 40's give you strong bones and taste like ice cream.
The case reads 'Call of Booty 4: Maiden Chest Hair 2'. The cover contains pictures of people that seem to have temporarily misplaced their clothing.
After wiping off some well-settled grit & grime, it appears that these aren't 'Pain Killers' at all. The label reads 'Excruciatingly Painful Human Killers'.
A candy intent on mangling your mandible.
Cold purple icy stuff.
This hotdog looks old. Older than you.
(Hold SHIFT to use) This custom board is sick, tight, and wicked steezy rad with gnarly trucks and ill one-of-a-kind graphics. Get there faster, and in greater style, with this buttery ride.
Restores 10 health. Oh, and it's chocolate.
Restores 18 health. They look salty and delicious.
Restores 30 health (Pickles included!)
Restores 100 health and over 9,000 deliciousnesses.

item_object.item_desc: Rolled from Cuban tobacco leaves by real torcedores, Monticristo Cigars are among the finest in the world. Due to an embargo imposed by Paper Thin City in 1962, they are also illegal to purchase or possess.
Smoking is cool. Not just a little cool, but ripped leather-vest wearing, chain-gun toting, I drive over robots in my jet-fuel powered motorcycle with flames coming out of the back cool.
Fire. Fire is good.
The label reads "Contains as much caffeine as 96 cups of coffee. Not recommended for human consumption."
Soon, there will be 2 kinds of people. Those who use computers, and those who use Crackbooks. It's the laptop for the rest of us. Think differently.

The most popular phone on the market today, the xPhone 7G comes with a 16-Gigapixel camera, Eleventeen Zetabytes of storage, and a battery with over 9,000 jigga-watt hours of talk time. Plus, intergalactic voice roaming – the xPhone works in space, mother trucker.
This Trophemon is 1 of 4 known living members of its species; this bird type trophemon is extremely rare.
A Mobius Strip is a 2D object which exists in 3D space; it can be created by twisting a strip of paper one half turn, bending it into a loop, and taping the two ends together.
A zero-volume bottle. A one-sided surface. Almost paradoxically, a Klein Bottle has no inside or outside.
Google it.
A limited edition 1982 BC Richter Mockingbeest, complete with a pair of highly sought-after early-80's pickups. Sings like an angel and wails like a banshee.
The tag reads 'Made in Kazakhstan, 100% Kazakh Cotton. Not guaranteed to stop bullets, pencils, or small woodland animals.
It's the type of trashy bat you'd find in a pawnshop. It has a nail through it.
This looks like it could do some damage in the off-season.
The ultimate bat in the entire universe. Maybe in every universe...
A replica Japanese sword. Although fake, it looks like it could still do considerable damage.
A carbon steel Samurai sword. This bad boy could slice open just about anything... or anyone.
The greatest sword in the history of... swords.
This sledge has seen better days.
The Einsteinium has improved your smashing power considerably.
Thanks 'Recon' Bob! This mighty slegdehammer stands second to none in melee supremacy.
A basic handgun, used for gunning by hand.
A modern handgun that makes a cool sound when the trigger is pulled. Wheeee!
Each shot counts down toward the end of time.
The most underpowered of the shotgun brethren. It's still a shotgun... I guess.
A classic used by angry farmers and rabbit hunters everywhere.
The label reads "Street Cleaner".
It's fully automatic.
The very best there is. When you absolutely, positively... uhh... can we just say it's a really sweet gun?
Shhhhhh... it's a secret!
A pretty good replica of a real Gun License, except that the person pictured looks absolutely nothing like you. Hopefully the guy at the pawn shop won't notice.
A pretty good replica of a real Driver's License, except that the person pictured looks absolutely nothing like you.
This coat-hanger has seen better days. Aside from any sentimental, and potentially utilitarian, value, it looks pretty worthless.

It's a Phillips... or maybe a Robertson. In capable hands, it looks like it could either screw -- or unscrew -- screws. That's assuming that the screws aren't stripped, of course, and that it's the right size and shape for the screw one intends it to work with.
It's a condom. You bought it in the men's washroom, remember?
Awwwwww!
A regular old set of house keys.
It's a fancy girl-scarf.
Let's see... lipstick, keys... cellphone... and... a Slappchop? How did that get in here?
A gold wrist watch. This blingin' timepiece is worth some serious coin.
Looks like an engagement ring. Da Beers or Da Bears?
Complex Astronomy 127-5: Black holes and you.
A graphing calculator; this baby has solitaire on it!
This is no Number 2 Pencil, my friend. You're just one click away from graphite glory.
A paper bag. It's contents remain undisclosed.
This card gives you instant street cred. Valid until Depeche Mode loses their edge.
You don't want to be caught with your pants down carrying THIS package.
Restores 100 health. Joe makes one hell of a pie.
Restores 40 health. Covered in red hot awesome-sauce.
Restores 10 health, donut? Mmm... donut.
Restores 5 health. Beats office coffee any Monday of the week.
Restores 5 health. Some buttery looking orange-filled French moon thingy... seriously, WTF is this?
Restores 15 health. It's the kind of coffee your friends wish they had.
Restores 18 health. The banana split - undefeated world champion of frozen treats.
Restores 5 health. Life is always better with ice cream.... unless it's poisonous! This ice cream isn't poisonous, though.
Regular roll of TP... because you never know when you might need it.
Not valid in Fort McMurray, Paper Thin City, or Times Square locations. Limited time only, while supplies last, some conditions apply. See in-store for details.
...you OWN it. P.I.M.P.
You really can't ever have enough.
Looks like it might be made out of plastic... what a nice gift.
You are the Rock'n'Roll king of this dimension.

It's one hell of a drug.

It's the key to your Condo.
It's the key to your Penthouse.

This bed will help you get up earlier.
This alarm clock will help you get up earlier. And angrier.

Yum!

It's not made of chain and it doesn't shoot chains.

A badass sword for a badass dude.
Yuk!

It glows!
This really doesn't look safe.
Makes stars turn into lines.
Blows really really hard. Not to be confused with a hockey team from Toronto.
Because blue means good guy!

item_object.item_desc: A key to your Castle.
The card gives you access to the famous 'Benjamins Club'.
It's a crowbar key to the sewers.
It says "Chainsaw Club - No holds barred chainsaw fights every night at Jim's Gym".
It's a small piece of paper. The only visible words are 'Chainsaw Club'.
It's another clue to the Hardware Store murder. All it says is "Talk to Marty, he's usually out drinking".
The note reads "The killer was seeing a lady of the evening, she knows more."

"Ever since that day I freely gave out my basement suite, my world has turned upside down. Battling with drugs and alcohol, you were the only spot of sunshine in my life. But then this Ryan guy started coming around. I see him as a major obstacle in our relationship. An obsticle that needs...removing."
The mother of all rings.
It's a reusable, refillable, renewable source for coffee.

key to the new warehouse, abandoned shortly after it was finished being built
